item.title: Someone has abandoned boxes of tablets here., 8th September
item.description:
Despite raising this issue with you several times, there has been no improvement in the situation here. There is the usual fly tipping and also masses of clothes left next to the donation bin on Tower Bridge Road which is unsightly. The abandoned pharmaceuticals however now make this a public safety issue due to the devastating consequences should children pick them up and take them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grange Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped at usual fly tipping spot, 8th September
item.description:
Severs house hold items including tv and soiled mattress dumped at the usual fly tipping location (adjacent to Landfield children play area and ravens court). This is literally a weekly occurrence. Please take action action to prevent this

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Benthal Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2x commercial cherry pickers vehicles parked on the street, 8th September
item.description:
From 1-2 month me and our neighbours dealing with a 2x commercial cherry picker vehicles which are constantly parked at our street! The vehicles are parked sometimes on opposite sides of the street which makes really narrow space to drive through! For sure any fire man vehicles or so cannot drive through! As far as I found the information online it is illegal to park commercial vehicles on the residential streets. Can someone help please?!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39,41,43, Lyme Farm Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car on false registration plates, 8th September
item.description:
Black sports car on false registration plates. It has no front plate, back plate states T20 LTO. When registration is check on government web site the registration comes back as a MITSUBISHI, hybrid electric, which the car in question is most certainly not. The black sports car is also parked over a dropped curb, stoping wheelchair and push chairs not too be able to access dropped curb.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hadlow Road, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: We need bins for dog waste, 8th September
item.description:
Several people have complained about dog mess not being picked up. We need dog bins. There were 2 at the Old Hill end which were taken away some time ago. Why?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lubbock Road, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish and litter all along the Surrey Canal road, 8th September
item.description:
There is so much litter: plastic and glass bottles, beer cans, bags, food containers, more industrial and construction waste on the green banks between the road and the pedestrian and cyclist pathways it’s appaling. It is supposed to be a walking and a cycling path for pedestrians and cyclist but there is not one bin in sight and the pathway stretches for almost a mile. The recyling facility and incinerator SELCHP is just behind the wall: might be that the rubbish is falling from their trucks amd is also contributing to this this enormous amount of littering - so surely they should take some responsability too, It’s disgusting and makes you not want to walk down it. I am embarrased to bring friends and relatives for a walk, the littering issue is really prevalant in this area. Please clear it, put some bins (like one every 50 metres down other roads and streets too!) that are not reachable by foxes, and also empty them regularly. It’s truly that bad! On a windy day the litter flies pass our windows and down other streets - it’s like living in a rubbish bin - this is not acceptable!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 227-255, Ilderton Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping infront of the business entrance, 8th September
item.description:
There’s rubbish infront of this business entrance and is being blown onto the sidewalk and the road. It’s been like that for three month now and the waste is just growing. Please contact the business to have that cleared as it is unsightly and is causing litter pollution.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 227-255, Ilderton Road, Bermondsey, London
